skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit (100)

skillTree.localised_description: Loyal, fierce, powerful and surprisingly fast – a War Bear is a symbol of Kislev itself.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: Gospodar warlords have ruled over their clan's chosen territory for nearly a thousand years since the Great Conquest of Kislev. It is proper in the eyes of men that this arrangement continues, as who else could hold these scattered tribes together against the forces of Chaos?

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 when in own territory

skillTree.localised_description: There is no law in Kislev against the appropriation of civilian assets for military use, for any Kislevite would rush to offer hospitality to their cold and hungry soldiers fighting at the front.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 when in own territory
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 when in own territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The surgeons serving in the Motherland's armies are some of the best in the world, seeing as they have to somehow triage the horrific wounds caused by the Daemons and Warriors of Chaos.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some warriors add additional steel to their armor and weapons to more effectively defend against monstrous creatures. The additional weight takes great strength and training to use effectively, which comes as its own benefit.
This Boyar has commanded his architects to construct concealed fortifications and underground tunnels, the more effectively to entrap and repel foreign invaders.
You see that flag Daemon? My fathers have defended this place against your misbegotten kind for centuries, and it will fly here for centuries more when you and I are gone. Now, let's finish this...
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +3% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars and Streltsi units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Yepiskop Battalion and Streltsi units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +6% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars and Streltsi units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Yepiskop Battalion and Streltsi units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +9% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars and Streltsi units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "There's ice in the veins of the mighty Guards of Kislev, or so the rumour goes…"

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Acolytes of Ursun, Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Acolytes of Ursun and Tzar Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The thunderous pounding of Kislevite hooves can be heard for leagues around, even muffled by the crunch of fresh snow.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +12% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +8% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units

Speed: +12% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +18% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Horse Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The beasts that roam the forests of Kislev are somehow even more lethal than the land they inhabit.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear and Snow Leopard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear and Snow Leopard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear and Snow Leopard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear and Snow Leopard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear and Snow Leopard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Kislevite craftsmen toil night and day, tinkering with contraptions to help repel the forces of Chaos.

effects.description:
Armour: +8 for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Yepiskop Battalion, Streltsi and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Yepiskop Battalion, Streltsi and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Snow Leopard, Acolytes of Ursun and Tzar Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bears, Snow Leopard, Acolytes of Ursun and Tzar Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bears, Snow Leopard, Acolytes of Ursun and Tzar Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The workshops of the north are always busy, their engineers working tirelessly in the pursuit of battle excellence.

Ammunition: +20% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Some men are natural leaders, born to foster and marshal their tribes through devastating wars and the harshest of winters.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: For those used to life in the oblasts, keeping the elements out is only the beginning of the measures they must take to ensure the survival of their people.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This valorous warrior has been at the forefront of the struggle against Ruin before, and they certainly shall be again, steeled and girded by that dreadful experience.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: By right of his storied experience, this one is trusted to make sound judgements in the best interests of the Motherland.
The ancient Khan-Queen Miska practised Ice Magic to the very highest grade; this one studies her methods in the hope of attaining similar greatness herself.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Kossars are blood of Kislev.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -2% for Kossars units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +2 for Kossars units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The famous Winged Lancers of Kislev are mostly made up of young sons of Boyars from all across the lands.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Know your place!
Test for true men!
Know your enemy, know yourself.
